    • Field Detail

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShaCircuit

        public ShaCircuit​(int n)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Builds a SHA 256 circuit. The argument is the number of 512-bit blocks of input. Note that to actually compute the hash, one must: (1) pad as prescribed in the SHA spec to a multiple of 512-bits, and, (2) Instantiate appropriate IntegerAsCircuit circuits, fuse their outputs with the input wires of this circuit, and invoke evaluate() on this circuit.
        Parameters:
        n -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
